last_episode_to_air.name: Papa Doc: Haiti's President for Life
last_episode_to_air.overview: A profile of François Duvalier (1907-1971), who ruled Haiti from 1957 to 1971 and declared himself president for life in 1964.

name: The Evolution of Evil
overview: Inside the minds of the heartless, corrupt, and cruel individuals who've seized control of their country through the infliction of appalling pain on their fellow man. From Kim Jong-il, to Osama Bin Laden, to Hitler, uncover the madness behind the merciless dictators responsible for unimaginable human atrocities that still haunt the world.

episodes.name: Papa Doc: Haiti's President for Life
episodes.overview: A profile of François Duvalier (1907-1971), who ruled Haiti from 1957 to 1971 and declared himself president for life in 1964.

episodes.name: Stalin: Russia's Steel Tyrant
episodes.overview: A profile of Joseph Stalin (1878-1953), the Soviet tyrant who ruled for 29 years and was responsible for some 20 million deaths.

episodes.name: Mao: China's Chairman of Death
episodes.overview: A profile of Mao Tse-tung (1893-1976), who ruled Communist China for nearly three decades.

episodes.name: Bin Laden: A Terrorist Mastermind
episodes.overview: A profile of Osama bin Laden (1957-2011), who was born into a wealthy family in Saudi Arabia but became the leader of Al Qaeda.

episodes.name: Hitler: The Benchmark of Terror
episodes.overview: A profile of Adolf Hitler examines his childhood and difficult relationship with his father.

episodes.name: Kim: North Korea's Evil Dynasty
episodes.overview: A profile of Kim Jong Il, the supreme leader of North Korea from 1994 to 2011.

episodes.name: Saddam: The Butcher of Baghdad
episodes.overview: A profile of Saddam Hussein (1937-2006), the ruthless Iraqi dictator who was captured in 2003 following the U.S.-led invasion of Iraq and executed in 2006.

episodes.name: Tojo: Japan's Razor of Fear
episodes.overview: A profile of Hideki Tojo (1884-1948), a Japanese general and prime minister during World War II who was sentenced to death and executed in 1948 for committing war crimes.

episodes.name: Mussolini: The Father of Fascism
episodes.overview: Benito Mussolini (1883-1945) rises through the Socialist ranks to become Italy's fascist dictator and Hitler's ally during World War II.

episodes.name: Gaddafi: Mad Dog of the Middle East
episodes.overview: A look at the reigns of the some of the world's most notorious dictators and despots begins with Libyan leader Muammar Gaddafi (1942-2011), who ruled for more than four decades before he was captured and killed during the Libyan Civil War.
